intro: Hieracium seticaule, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or deeply cut. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium seticaule is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
